subject: AccuWeather.com Alert(tm) Advisory  (avcavc)
body:
AccuWeather.com Alert[TM]






















 







							Severe Watches and Warnings for BEVERLY HILLS 













LOXCFWLOX
WHUS46 KLOX 130630
CFWLOX

COASTAL HAZARD MESSAGE
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LOS ANGELES/OXNARD CA
1130 PM PDT THU APR 12 2007

..HIGH SURF CONTINUES ON SOUTHWEST FACING BEACHES OF SOUTHERN
CALIFORNIA...

STRONG WEST TO NORTHWEST FLOW OVER THE COASTAL WATERS WILL GENERATE
A SOMEWHAT LARGE WESTERLY SWELL. IN ADDITION...A MODERATE SOUTHERLY
SWELL FROM A PREVIOUS STORM IN THE SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE CONTINUES TO
IMPACT THE AREA. THIS COMBINATION OF WESTERLY AND SOUTHERLY SWELLS
WILL PRODUCE HIGH SURF ALONG THE EXPOSED SOUTHWEST FACING BEACHES OF
SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA AS WELL AS HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK THROUGH FRIDAY
NIGHT.

CAZ040-041-131300-
/O.CON.KLOX.SU.Y.0006.000000T0000Z-070414T0500Z/
VENTURA COUNTY COAST-
LOS ANGELES COUNTY COAST INCLUDING DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES-
1130 PM PDT THU APR 12 2007

..HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT FRIDAY...

A HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT FRIDAY.

FIVE TO SEVEN FOOT BREAKERS ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE AT THE
BEACHES OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTY...ESPECIALLY AT
FAVORABLY EXPOSED SOUTHWEST FACING BEACHES THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT.
MAX SETS UP TO EIGHT FEET ARE POSSIBLE AT THE MOST EXPOSED
LOCATIONS. WHILE THE GUSTY WINDS WHICH ARE DRIVING THIS SWELL
HAVE BEGUN TO DIMINISH...CONDITIONS ARE STILL EXPECTED TO BE
HAZARDOUS THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THE COMBINATION
OF HIGH SURF WITH THE NORTHWEST AND SOUTH SWELLS WILL ALSO PRODUCE
DANGEROUS RIP CURRENTS ALONG THE BEACHES OF LOS ANGELES AND
VENTURA COUNTIES. SURF WILL SUBSIDE BY FRIDAY EVENING.

$$

CAZ034-035-131300-
/O.NEW.KLOX.CF.S.0004.070413T0630Z-070414T0500Z/
SAN LUIS OBISPO COUNTY CENTRAL COAST-
SANTA BARBARA COUNTY CENTRAL COAST-
1130 PM PDT THU APR 12 2007

..ABOVE NORMAL SURF EXPECTED ALONG THE CENTRAL COAST...

SEVEN TO NINE FOOT BREAKERS ARE EXPECTED ALONG THE CENTRAL
CALIFORNIA COAST FRIDAY...WITH LOCAL SETS TO TWELVE FEET ALONG
FAVORABLE WEST FACING BEACHES. WHILE THE PERIOD OF THESE WAVES IS
ONLY NEAR TWELVE SECONDS...A STRONG NORTHWEST SWELL DRIVEN BY
NORTHWEST WINDS WILL IMPACT THE COASTLINE THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON.
SURF SHOULD SUBSIDE BY FRIDAY EVENING.

$$

MEIER/HALL
